page.title: 09Tourism in North Yorkshire
page.content: {Tourism}affects all who live here, though not necessarily by choice. There is either a positive, antagonistic or indifferent approach by the residents. Those with a positive approach recognise the benifits tourism brings & that it is becoming an important part of the rural economy. Some may be upset by the changes in their normally tranquil lifestyle as during the summer months the small country lanes become busy. However,the underlying attitude is a willingness to share with others what they themselves enjoy all the year round. The area is a good centre for visitors to explore the North Yorks moors & coast. The scenery is varied with hills,woods,fields & moorland. Stone built farms & cottages blend into the landscape which changes with the seasons.
